intro: Aylostera applanata, commonly known as the flat-leaf aylostera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Aylostera applanata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
